newsitem.title: FRANCE: PRESS DIGEST - France - Le Monde June 6.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - France - Le Monde June 6.

text.p: These are leading stories in afternoon daily Le Monde.
-- Prime Minister Lionel Jospin reaffirms his conditions for France to join a European single currency and his committment to meeting the 1999 deadline.
-- Environment Minister Dominique Voynet confirms wants controversial Rhine-Rhone canal project scrapped and the route of a proposed high-speed train line changed.

-- CGT labour union leader Louis Viannet in an interview calls for a rise in minimum wage (SMIC), says government should not wait for planned conference on wages to tackle SMIC rise and calls into question the Maastricht criteria.
